intro: Anagallis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, and it blooms from spring to summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it is often found in open, sunny habitats. Anagallis angustifolia is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
